website_summaries.verdict: If you are a cook who likes to try out innovative designs in cookware, chances are you will find this sauté pan useful; however, it has some limitations.
pros: Stands out for the unique oval shape that leaves more room to fit other pans on stove burners
cons: Somewhat prone to warping, as the bottom could be thicker

customer_reviews.title: This is a great size, but i doesn't seem to cook meat ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a skillet that is also oven safe! This is a great size, but i doesn't seem to cook meat on the stove as fast as others do, not sure if it's because of it's oval shape?? I only use this to cook meat/chicken if it's a casserole or something I need to put in the oven as well. Otherwise, I use my OTHER Rachael Ray round skillet!
customer_reviews.author: EJ Wall

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The handle was broken so I contacted the seller and was sent another one in two days and it was perfect! Great experience with the item and love this pan! Great product and excellent customer service! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPrimeMember

customer_reviews.title: BOTTOM SCRATCHES EASILY!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted an oval Saute pan, and purchased this one from Rachel Ray since I liked the size and color. The first day I used it, it performed beautifully, but when washing it I noticed some scratches on the bottom, I own a gas stove and I handled it very carefully. Hope this will last¡!
customer_reviews.author: Z. Rezk

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped it would be!
customer_reviews.text: I had an oval pressure cooker that made it easier to use than the traditional round devices. When I saw Rachel's oval pasta pot I shopped it for price and the feedback. Used it today and not disappointed. So easy to use and clean. The lid fits fine, I mention this as there has been some feedback indicating the lid doesn't fit properly when draining. I did not have that issue. Note, after much thought I chose the hard anodized which is a bit more expensive over the beautiful blue, and I don't regret it. All of my other pots are hard anodized. Looks and functions very well.
customer_reviews.author: Edie F

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and works great for pasta and other soups and sauces. I have grown to love this line of pots from RR. I have Caphalon, All Clad, Staub, Le Creuset, and other high end cookware but it seems I always gravitate to the RR pots. The cook well and are a breeze to clean up. Also, the fact the are not heavy makes them easy to use. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward size
customer_reviews.text: I find this works well for pasta as Rachel often demonstrates, but I find the pan an awkward fit for my "round burners". The lid on this pan is also somewhat tricky. If not very careful it falls in to pot if you don't place it just right on pot. Love the handles however, no need for pot holders.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Egan /Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the purpose and the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth one over the years. It is not the most durable, it has eventually warped each time over the years, but I have a double burner and it is prefect for the use and price. I can only guess that I it lasts about 18 months to 2 years. IF the bottom was thicker it would not warp.
customer_reviews.author: Doogie

customer_reviews.title: We use this pan for anything we don't want slopping ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this pan for anything we don't want slopping over the edge of our other pans...Shrimp etoufee, french fried potatoes, stir fry's, etc. We only buy Rachel Ray Anodized pots and pans. Over the last ten years we have had to replace all the pans once, and an odd one here or there. We cook all our meals at home, so they are almost all used at least once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: So/so pot
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was better quality ,But no very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Bounser2012

customer_reviews.title: Good pot, bad lid!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pot to use for Pasta and corn on the cob! Only bad part is the cover warped so it does not fit on the pot at all. I hand wash my pots and pans and always cool them before washing, so not sure how it warped so bad!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ducharme

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: This pan is just OK. It heats uneven. The oval shape can come in handy. But with the handle and the oval shape, it can be very long and tough to fit in a cabinet. If it didn’t heat unevenly, I would give it higher grade.
customer_reviews.author: Todd MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: Love this for spaghetti
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot for spaghetti, lasagna, manicotti, etc. It's so nice not to have to break my noodles to fit in the pot and the length means no 1/2 mushy noodles. So far I've only hand washed it but it's easy to clean. It's easy to drain from the side hole but watch for steam over the stove when you're cooking. Overall I like this product and am glad I purchased it. Make sure you have room to store...it's not shaped like other pots to stack.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Paternostro

customer_reviews.title: Just get it. It is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the money and cooks food to perfection. I love that it has an oval shape and still manages to deliver the correct heat throughout the pan. This is a must have for your collection. Thank you Rachel ! You did this the right way!
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Kinimod

customer_reviews.title: Awesome oval pan
customer_reviews.text: There are so many more uses than you realize for an oval pan. Just try it and you won't want to be without one. Great for cooking pasta instead of a large deep pot!
customer_reviews.author: Lorri A. Sword

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars! It's perf 👌
customer_reviews.text: 6 or so inches high, I use this as a huge pot for all the veggies with out it going over the sides.... No spillage.... While stirring the pot. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Gina M.

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected and wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that I had bought an oval pan but when I used it, and I've used it a few times, I found I loved it! It evenly disperses heat even though it isn't round. I have never bought a high priced pan, usually they are 20 to 30 dollars for my pans, but I splurged and just love the quality and the high standards that are brought to this pan
customer_reviews.author: Bradly Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: Used pot for a variety of foods. Live my new pot. Love how steam comes out on sides and no boiling over. Love shape of pot. Cooks food with great seal.
customer_reviews.author: April C Griffin

customer_reviews.title: oval!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize this was an oval pan until it arrived. Still great quality and we use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Angelo

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Piece of Cookware
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement pan as the first one lasted for years but was scratched. I recommend this pan as it holds a large amount of good, is easy to clean and looks great. The price was the lowest for such a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: Love Rachel Ray pans
customer_reviews.text: Everything about them is terrific. We have three skillets and one large lidded 5 quart pan!
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: great sized pan
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife as she loves the Rachel Ray line. So far its worked really well and is a good size for us. Note the pan is really deep and fairly good size so check your requirements/size of your range before purchasing. The quality seems to be pretty good and I think it should last a long time. Overall, a good purchase and we hope to add more of RR's line soon.
customer_reviews.author: Safety Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the 5 thy eye of stoves
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the 5th eye on the new fangled stoves. It holds a lot of meal kits. I am giving it a 4 because the bottom got scratched from my standard Samsung stove. it could be more durable
customer_reviews.author: V. Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It was a present for my daughter. She loves it. She says it’s great for cooking pasta!
customer_reviews.author: ann H S

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I just love my pasta pot! I have almost all of Rachael Ray cookware. All her things works great for me, I love to cook and I love all non-stick equipment. Just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. It's my 2nd one. I have a husband and kids that are hard on my pans. If not for them, I wouldn't have had to replace the 1st one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenrae

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the oblong middle burner of your stove.
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a pan for that middle oblong burner of my stove. It fits perfect and is good for cooking those long items that don't fit into a normal square or round pan like asparagus. It fits a lot of food at one time also. There is nothing that I don't like about this pan. Its easy to clean and the food does not stick to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Matthis Mowatt

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: If your a big pasta family like we are you’ll love this. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Great pan. Okay shape..
customer_reviews.text: This 5qt pan is amazing! Cooks great and clean up is a cinch. Only drawback is the oblong shape makes it more difficult to place the lid on evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Rothmiin

customer_reviews.title: Great Saute Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan can be used for so many things. I love it and it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Rachael Ray
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the Rachael Ray line but my wife absolutely loves the cookware, lasagna pans, etc. I purchased this for a Christmas present and the qualit seems excellent. After using this for the past month, I absolutely love the quality and how well food cooks. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lake Jr

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this before, LOVE this pan !
customer_reviews.text: This pan is light weight, cleans easily, is nice and long. It has a spout for pouring and for steam to escape. I had wanted to purchase this pan several years ago. Glad I finally have it. I use it 3 or more times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this pan - perfect for all encompassing meals like goulash, stews and soups
customer_reviews.author: Eileen202

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive... works good for a while, but bottom is warping after continuous heat. Bought two, one for mom and one for wife. Same issues
customer_reviews.author: A Lee

customer_reviews.title: Must own one
customer_reviews.text: This fits lasagna noodles perfect. So glad I purchased this just wish i had it sooner. No more breaking spaghetti in half either anymore with this pot. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: JANEEN GODFREY

customer_reviews.title: Akward
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to cook , clean and store. Rachel Ray's products are normally wonderful this one just isn't for me I gave it to my daughter
customer_reviews.author: margy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than I thought it would be. Very happy! So easy to clean and comes out nice from dishwasher 😁😁😁
customer_reviews.author: history

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, Practical, Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Great for just about everything. Easy to make big dishes for friends and family. Easy to clean. First pan lasted about a year of nearly daily use.
customer_reviews.author: ello

customer_reviews.title: Great for Spaghetti and Corn on the cob
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. Great fr boiling pasta and corn on the cob!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great pot, and not just for cooking pasta!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality pot, and not just for cooking pasta. It is very high quality, heats quickly and makes cooking long spaghetti noodles a breeze. I also use it for stews and soups when I need to make a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Like it very much for everything I cook. Very versatile pan.
customer_reviews.author: michael p senn

customer_reviews.title: This item is top quality and is exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: I love this item and my husband loves what comes out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice Kirksey

customer_reviews.title: Spaghetti pan
customer_reviews.text: I like I can drop spaghetti right into the pan without waiting for it to get soft to fit
customer_reviews.author: Gail Eisele

customer_reviews.title: Nice oval saute
customer_reviews.text: Use this pan ~3-4 times a week and it works great. The nonstick surface is great for cooking and cleans up quickly and easily. I use a plastic spatula for most of the cooking and have not experienced any scratching on the interior surface. Unique oval shape allows for the cooking of larger food items.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The best pit. Use it for everything. One pit neals.
customer_reviews.author: OldiesMusic

customer_reviews.title: Pasta Pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this item....it met all my expectations.....I only make my pasta in this pot now!!!😁😋
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S. Turner

customer_reviews.title: heavy dutty
customer_reviews.text: works perfect love the pour spout nice touch very well made
customer_reviews.author: brian rochon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Wait
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted this pot for awhile now and finally broke down and purchased it when I received an Amazon gift certificate for my birthday. I've looked for something similar in shape and size for a long time and couldn't find anything comparable. This pot is great...I was afraid that since it sits further out on the sides from the burner that it wouldn't cook evenly or heat quickly and it absolutely does...I think it heats water quicker than my old pasta pot...but that could be my imagination. It does cook everything evenly and washes up like a dream...and it is great for a lot of different recipes...not just pasta.
customer_reviews.author: whoffman691

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I love RR products. This is my second 8 quart.
customer_reviews.author: CoolNevadaGirl

customer_reviews.title: It's a little too big for my flat-top stoves burner ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a little too big for my flat-top stoves burner, but it makes it so much easier to make large meals (that I'm constantly watching anyhow), that it doesn't make too much of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money, non stick seems pretty high quality, useful shape for a pot.

customer_reviews.title: Spaghetti cooker
customer_reviews.text: Will cook a lot of noodles Can be used for other large items
customer_reviews.author: marylynn dibble

customer_reviews.title: Another terrific Pan by Rachael Ray
customer_reviews.text: I have other Rachael Ray hard anodized non-stick pans so this is no surprise that it is another great pan
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite pans.
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this pan. Being able to cook on the top of the stove and also being able to put it into the oven. I use this almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: ivy

customer_reviews.title: I love this pasta pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this pasta pot. It's great for pasta but also sweet corn in the summer and soup all winter.

customer_reviews.title: The shape is priceless!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the shape of this pan. User friendly for any stove top.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ths is a nice pan my wife like it very much. I would recommend it to anyone .

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves this pan. Her gas stove has a double long burner, and it was a good fit. Well made.

customer_reviews.title: Italian One
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for pasta or making a large quantity of sauce. I love it. Only negative is anodized lip was chipped when I opened it.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan, can do a lot with it. Clean up is a breeze!

customer_reviews.title: Does its job!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my daughter who loved it. I have one and use it many times a week.

customer_reviews.title: Pot Design
customer_reviews.text: Heat not evenly distributed to ends of pot due to stove burners being round and pot elongated. Still like.

customer_reviews.title: Only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: This pan is high quality and well-made, and it fits well on my range. I just wish it had a pour spout on one side for draining grease, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Billie J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fits well over 2 elements plus the bridge. We've found several extra times to use it that we didn't consider when ordering it. Handy addition to our collection.

customer_reviews.title: Best sauté pan!
customer_reviews.text: skillet meals, pancakes, just about anything that needs to be sautéed or griddled.

customer_reviews.title: Love

customer_reviews.text: Love the shape of this pan. I have a set of her pots and pans and this is a nice addition to them.

customer_reviews.title: Rachael Ray Porcelain II 5-Quart Covered Green Saute Pan with Helper Handle

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Rachael Ray's hard anodized cookware is the best cookware I have ever had. I highly recommend any of her products to everyone whether you are a novice cook or highly experienced. The quality for the price is wonderful.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this spaghetti pot, in fact I must admit it's my favorite 🍝

customer_reviews.title: Cooks Spaghettie like a CHAMP!

Looks are important too as it matches the other pots in the kitchen (those are Rachel Ray as well). My wife tells me that it also boils soup and can cook other foods as well, so its a great multi-use pot! It looks great on the stove top, except for the fact that its oval, but that's a minor thing compared to how well it can boil water.

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.title: This description is incorrect. It is actually the Hard ...

customer_reviews.title: An everyday kind of pan!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan over 2 years ago. Never put it in the dishwasher. And has lasted this long, and is still in excellent condition! I use it almost everyday. I have a family of 5 healthy eaters. It is perfect for large appetites! I would buy any pan in the Rachel Ray set!!!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!

Super ease to clean. Well worth the money!

product_meta.title: Rachael Ray Brights Hard Anodized Nonstick Saute Pan / Frying Pan / Fry Pan - 5 Quart, Gray
product_meta.description: Size:5 QuartEnjoy cooking big one-pot meals without sacrificing space on the cooktop with Rachael Ray’s 5-Quart Hard Anodized Nonstick Oval Saute Pan with Lid and Helper Handle. Great for browning, stir frying, searing and more, you can’t go wrong with this large capacity nonstick saute pan. The durable hard-anodized cookware construction has been engineered to heat evenly throughout the pan and a helper handle has been added for an extra boost when moving the pan from cooktop to oven (oven safe to 350°F). The shatter resistant glass lid locks in heat and flavor, and the nonstick saute pan is dishwasher safe for quick and easy cleanup. Get hard-anodized high performance with the stylish and durable Rachael Ray 5-Quart Hard Anodized Nonstick Oval Saute Pan with Lid and Helper Handle.
feature_bullets: SAUTE PAN WITH HELPER HANDLE: 5-quart, oval-shaped nonstick sauté pan with lid and helper handle features hard anodized cookware construction for durability and even-heating
ENHANCED NONSTICK COOKWARE: Saute pan is covered with superior nonstick inside and out for effortless food release and easy, dishwasher safe cleanup
OVEN SAFE: Oven safe to 350 degrees F, the nonstick pan is dishwasher safe for convenience and works great with many other pieces in the Rachael Ray collections
EXTRA CAPACITY: The sauté’s unique oval shape takes up less space on the stovetop and its deep sides provide extra capacity
SEAL IN HEAT AND FLAVOR: Comfortable rubberized handles on the oval sauté are dual riveted for strength; a shatter-resistant glass lid locks in heat and flavor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars605 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
